summary: App should show journey schedule via a 2D page view: clicking the Map button should navigate to a 2D page for the selected journey city and highlight/display the corresponding schedule item (instead of opening a popup).

existing_features.title: Replace the current Travelogue “Map” button behavior that opens a popup/dialog with navigation to the existing 2D map view in LocationMapExplorer, centered on the selected journey city.

When the Travelogue Map button is invoked for a specific schedule item, ensure the 2D map view also displays and focuses the corresponding schedule item (e.g., by automatically opening/spotlighting that schedule item’s marker/popup on the 2D map).

Implement a URL/state handoff so that switching to the 2D view from the Map button persists enough information to load the correct journey city and schedule item even after a page refresh (use the existing URL param utilities in frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts).

Apply the behavior change only to the user-selected UI elements (the Map button control in the header and the popup container currently used for the Map action), ensuring other dialogs (e.g., itinerary and edit schedule dialogs) continue to function unchanged.

new_feature_requests.summary: Change Map button behavior to navigate to the 2D page for the selected journey city and display the corresponding schedule item (no popup).

projectName: Change Travelogue Map button to navigate to 2D view and focus the selected journey/schedule item (no popup)
